reviews.text: Beautiful Cathedral 162 years old being tastily restored😉

Well worth a visit
One of the oldest Cathedrals around
Very well maintained
Well worth a visit , food excellent well presented, staff,nothing seems to be a problem to them.

The cathedral for the diocese of Ossory. Well worth a visit for anybody interested in religious architecture, it was built in 1847, a recent edition was the installation of a gold ceiling above the altar. Otherwise it's a fully functioning Cathedral hosting masses, weddings, funerals, confirmations and confessions etc.
Mooi historisch pand aan de markt. Rondleidingen door het pand worden gegeven door Kring Vrienden van 's-Hertogenbosch.  Te boeken via dagjedenbosch.com. Een aanrader.

In dit pand is onder andere de Ombudsman van de gemeente 's-Hertogenbosch gevestigd.
Deze Ombudsman is vaak de laatste strohalm die mensen hebben.
Echter is deze commissie niet van fouten verschoond, fouten die zij zelf toegegeven hebben.

Toch weerhouden die fouten hen er niet van om 'over lijken te gaan' en medewerkers van de gemeente die hun boekje te buiten gaan een handje boven het hoofd te blijven houden ! 

Wat in een onprofessionele, bijna corrupte en incompetente organisatie resulteert.
Men zal zich hier uiteraard 'niet in herkennen' maar dat is altijd het standaard rookgordijn dat snel opgetrokken wordt om zaken binnenkamers te houden.
Cool place, but food is not so good.
Service was not great, restaurant is much smaller than expected and food was just ok.
Good restaurant but prices are to high

I have been here twice in 1 week.  The 1st time, the steaks were great and so was the gentleman server.  This is the only reason for 2 stars.

The second time however, the blonde female server was terrible and the food was ok.  Three in our party.  They were supposedly out of bottles of wine.  At least she told us that, but we saw carafes full of wine being served.  We all three ordered starters and she did not put them in and blamed it on a computer problem.  I asked for her to make it up somehow and she blew us off.  I tried not paying for the service charge for the terrible service but that didn't go over very well.

It may be a coincidence but I saw the police called on an English speaking woman alone there at lunch.  It was quite the altercation... she didn't look intoxicated.  I hope the treatment is not for being English speaking.

The traditional Czech dishes ruined by not serving the right condiments. Instead of "houskové knedle" you get plain and when you mention this to the serving staff you are treated as stupid tourist who doesn't know what you asked for.

One of my favorite restaurants. Impressive menu choices and I am never disappointed when navigating trying new things. Their happy hour deals are a must and the sushi is outstanding. If going for brunch definitely try the oyster shooters.

A group of friends and I went on Saturday night after hanging out in Doylestown for a bit. We were at the back bar for a good 2 hours and between everyone we spent around $600. The back bartender was great and we were all minding our business and hanging out within our group. We were all walking out to leave and one of the servers was sent over by the manager to us telling us we were being kicked out? He didn’t have any reasoning behind it other then he was told one of us fell (which is false) and that we could talk to the manager about it. When we asked the manager about it he was standing at the front with his arms crossed and a smug look on his face and wouldn’t even talk to us and just told us to get out. Glad to know you can spend tons of money at an establishment and still be treated so horrible. Will never be going back there and will never recommend.

went in with friends after a St.Patty's day crawl. The front Bartender couldn't have been any ruder.  clientele is snobby and rude as bartender. I have lived in this area for 20 years. will never go here again. I'll be sure to stick with the Mesquito Grille where they treat all their patrons with dignity . My review is the same as Jamie Rocks. apparently its normal there.
I like this place alot.  Its trendy, cool with a really nice crowd.  The food is great, friendly cute servers, efficient friendly bartenders, AND a gorgeous outdoor bar in season...go !

Surprisingly this Sushi / steak restaurant has fantastic vegetarian options. I enjoyed the Impossible Burger along with a Christmas-themed mule. The restaurant itself is beautiful.  A wee bit of Philadelphia in Doylestown!
